page.title: 16 The Whitegate Way
page.content: The Whitegate Way is a dismantled railway that ran from the salt mine in Winsford to Chester were it joined on to the main line. It was used to carry salt from the mines without being delayed. The Whitegate Way was finally dismantled when the bridge, now known as The Broken Bridge, became unsafe and had to be pulled down,although it had already been abandoned. Whitegate Way is now used as a nature walk and,in parts,as a bridle path. Along the Whitegate Way a variety of trees,wild flowers,birds and insects can be observed.Whitegate Way provides a pleasant afternoon walk.
